diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Necrotizing acute appendicitis with perforation and early abscess formation.
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with classic signs of appendicitis, including right lower quadrant pain, nausea, and tenderness with rebound and guarding on physical examination. A CT scan confirmed the diagnosis, showing an enlarged appendix with an appendicolith, periappendiceal stranding, and no evidence of increased intra-abdominal fluid or obstruction.
